name: Dart
title: A Dart cheat sheet with the most important concepts, functions, methods, and more. A complete quick reference for beginners.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: A Dart cheat sheet with the most important concepts, functions, methods, and more. A complete quick reference for beginners.

cards.title: hello.dart
cards.code: %2F%2F%20top-level%20function%20where%20app%20execution%20starts%0Avoid%20main()%7B%0A%20%20%20%20print(%22Hello%20World!%22)%3B%20%2F%2F%20Print%20to%20console%0A%7D

cards.body: Every app has a main() function

cards.title: Variables
cards.code: int%20x%20%3D%202%3B%20%2F%2F%20explicitly%20typed%0Avar%20p%20%3D%205%3B%20%2F%2F%20type%20inferred%20-%20Generic%20var%20with%20type%20inference%0A%0Adynamic%20z%20%3D%208%3B%20%2F%2F%20variable%20can%20take%20on%20any%20type%0Az%20%3D%20%22cool%22%3B%20%2F%2F%20cool%0A%0A%2F%2F%20if%20you%20never%20intend%20to%20change%20a%20variable%20use%20final%20or%20const.%20Something%20like%20this%3A%0A%0Afinal%20email%20%3D%20%22temid%40gmail.com%22%3B%20%2F%2F%20Same%20as%20var%20but%20cannot%20be%20reassigned%0Afinal%20String%20email%20%3D%20%22temid%40gmail.com%22%3B%20%2F%2F%20you%20can't%20change%20the%20value%0A%0Aconst%20qty%20%3D%205%3B%20%2F%2F%20Compile-time%20constant

cards.title: Datatypes
cards.code: %0Aint%20age%20%3D%2020%3B%20%2F%2F%20integers%2C%20range%20-2%5E63%20to%202%5E63%20-%201%0Adouble%20height%20%3D%201.85%3B%20%2F%2F%20floating-point%20numbers%0A%0A%2F%2F%20You%20can%20also%20declare%20a%20variable%20as%20a%20num%0Anum%20x%20%3D%201%3B%20%20%2F%2F%20x%20can%20have%20both%20int%20and%20double%20values%0Ax%20%2B%3D%202.5%3B%0Aprint(x)%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%203.5%0A%0AString%20name%20%3D%20%22Nicola%22%3B%0A%0Abool%20isFavourite%20%3D%20true%3B%0Abool%20isLoaded%20%3D%20false%3B

cards.title: String%20interpolation
cards.code: %2F%2F%20can%20use%20single%20or%20double%20qoutes%20for%20String%20type%0Avar%20firstName%20%3D%20'Nicola'%3B%0Avar%20lastName%20%3D%20%22Tesla%22%3B%0A%0A%2F%2Fcan%20embed%20variables%20in%20string%20with%20%24%0AString%20fullName%20%3D%20%22%24firstName%20%24lastName%22%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20concatenate%20with%20%2B%0Avar%20name%20%3D%20%22Albert%20%22%20%2B%20%22Einstein%22%3B%0A%0AString%20upperCase%20%3D%20'%24%7BfirstName.toUpperCase()%7D'%3B%0Aprint(upperCase)%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%20NICOLA

cards.title: Comments
multiline String
Imports
Arithmatic Operators
cards.code:
print(2 + 3); //Print: 5
print(2 - 3); //Print: -1
print(2 * 3); //Print: 6
print(5 / 2);  //Print: 2.5 - Result is a double
print(5 ~/ 2); //Print: 2 - Result is an int
print(5 % 2); //Print: 1 - Remainder

int a = 1, b;
// Increment
b = ++a; // preIncrement - Increment a before b gets its value.
b = a++; // postIncrement - Increment a AFTER b gets its value.

//Decrement
b = --a; // predecrement - Decrement a before b gets its value.
b = a--; // postdecrement - Decrement a AFTER b gets its value.

cards.title: Equality and relational operators
cards.code:
print(2 == 2);  //Print: true - Equal
print(2 != 3); //Print: true - Not  Equal
print(3 > 2); //Print: true - Grater than
print(2 < 3); //Print: true - Less than
print(3 >= 3); //Print: true - Greater than or equal to
print(2 <= 3); //Print: true - Less than or equal to

cards.title: Logical operators
switch case
while loop

cards.body: while loop check condition before iteration of the loop

cards.title: do-while loop

cards.body: do-while loop verifies the condition after the execution of the statements inside the loop

cards.title: for loop
for in loop
Lists
cards.code: %2F%2F%20ordered%20group%20of%20objects%0Avar%20list%20%3D%20%5B1%2C%202%2C%203%5D%3B%0A%0Aprint(list.length)%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%203%0Aprint(list%5B1%5D)%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%202%0A%0A%2F%2F%20other%20ways%20of%20list%20declaration%20and%20initializations%0A%0AList%3CString%3E%20cities%20%3D%20%3CString%3E%5B%22New%20York%22%2C%20%22Mumbai%22%2C%20%22Tokyo%22%5D%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20To%20create%20a%20list%20that%E2%80%99s%20a%20compile-time%20constant%0Aconst%20constantCities%20%3D%20const%20%5B%22New%20York%22%2C%20%22Mumbai%22%2C%20%22Tokyo%22%5D%3B

cards.title: Sets
Maps
Functions
Arrow Syntax (=>)
cards.code:
// functions that contain just one expression, you can use a shorthand syntax
bool isFav(Product product) => favProductsList.contains(product);

cards.title: Anonymous (lambda) functions
Object
cards.code: %2F%2F%20instance%20of%20a%20class%0A%2F%2F%20below%20myCat%20is%20Object%20of%20class%20Cat%0A%0Avoid%20main()%7B%0A%20%20%20%20Cat%20myCat%20%3D%20Cat()%3B%0A%20%20%20%20myCat.name%20%3D%20%22Kitty%22%3B%0A%20%20%20%20myCat.voice()%3B%20%2F%2F%20Prints%3A%20Meow%0A%7D

cards.title: Constructors
cards.code: class%20Cat%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20String%20name%3B%0A%20%20%20%20Cat(this.name)%3B%0A%7D%0Avoid%20main()%7B%0A%20%20%20%20Cat%20myCat%20%3D%20Cat(%22Kitty%22)%3B%0A%20%20%20%20print(myCat.name)%3B%20%2F%2F%20Prints%3A%20Kitty%0A%7D

Getters Setters
A basic interface
Extending a class

cards.code: %2F%2F%20throws%20or%20raises%20and%20exception%0Athrow%20IntegerDivisionByZeroException()%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20You%20can%20also%20throw%20arbitrary%20objects%0Athrow%20%22Product%20out%20of%20stock!%22%3B

cards.title: Catch
Finally
Async%20Await
cards.code: %2F%2F%20functions%20which%20are%20asynchronous%3A%20they%20return%20after%20setting%20up%20a%20possibly%20time-consuming%20operation%0A%2F%2F%20The%20async%20and%20await%20keywords%20support%20asynchronous%20programming%0A%0AFuture%3CString%3E%20login()%20%7B%0A%20String%20userName%3D%22Temidjoy%22%3B%0A%20return%0A%20%20Future.delayed(%0A%20%20%20%20Duration(seconds%3A%204)%2C%20()%20%3D%3E%20userName)%3B%0A%7D%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Asynchronous%0Amain()%20async%20%7B%0A%20print('Authenticating%20please%20wait...')%3B%0A%20print(await%20login())%3B%0A%7D

cards.title: Why%20use%20extensions%3F
cards.code: %2F%2F%20Extensions%20allow%20you%20to%20add%20methods%20to%20existing%0A%2F%2F%20classes%20without%20modifying%20them.%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Instead%20of%20defining%20a%20util%20class.%0Aclass%20StringUtil%20%7B%0A%20%20static%20bool%20isValidEmail(String%20str)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20final%20emailRegExp%20%3D%20RegExp(r%22%5E%5Ba-zA-Z0-9.%5D%2B%40%5Ba-zA-Z0-9%5D%2B%5C.%5Ba-zA-Z%5D%2B%22)%3B%0A%20%20%20%20return%20emailRegExp.hasMatch(str)%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%7D%0A%0Aprint(StringUtil.isValidEmail('someString'))%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%20false%0A%0A%2F%2F%20We%20can%20define%20an%20extension%20which%20will%20be%20applied%0A%2F%2F%20on%20a%20certain%20type.%0A%0Aextension%20StringExtensions%20on%20String%20%7B%0A%20%20bool%20get%20isValidEmail%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20final%20emailRegExp%20%3D%20RegExp(r%22%5E%5Ba-zA-Z0-9.%5D%2B%40%5Ba-zA-Z0-9%5D%2B%5C.%5Ba-zA-Z%5D%2B%22)%3B%0A%20%20%20%20return%20emailRegExp.hasMatch(this)%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%7D%0A%0Aprint('test%40example.com'.isValidEmail)%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%20true%0Aprint('SomeString'.isValidEmail)%3B%20%2F%2FPrint%3A%20false

cards.title: Generic Extensions
Dart Extensions in Flutter
Null and Null aware
cards.code:
int x; // The initial value of any object is null

// ?? null aware operator

x ??=6; // ??= assignment operator, which assigns a value of a variable only if that variable is currently null
print(x); //Print: 6

x ??=3;
print(x); // Print: 6 - result is still 6

print(null ?? 10); // Prints: 10. Display the value on the left if it's not null else return the value on the right

cards.title: Ternary Operator
Spread Operator (...)
Cascade%20notation%20(..)
cards.code: %2F%2F%20allows%20you%20to%20make%20a%20sequence%20of%20operations%20on%20the%20same%20object%0A%0A%2F%2F%20rather%20than%20doing%20this%0Avar%20user%20%3D%20User()%3B%0Auser.name%20%3D%20%22Nicola%22%3B%0Auser.email%20%3D%20%22nicola%40g.c%22%3B%0Auser.age%20%3D%2024%3B%0A%0A%2F%2F%20you%20can%20do%20this%0Avar%20user%20%3D%20User()%0A%20%20..name%20%3D%20%22Nicola%22%0A%20%20..email%20%3D%20%22nicola%40g.c%22%0A%20%20..age%20%3D%2024%3B

cards.title: Conditional Property Access
enum%20in%20dart
cards.code: defination%3A%20An%20enum%20(short%20for%20%22enumeration%22)%20is%20a%20special%20data%20type%20that%20enables%20a%20variable%20to%20be%20a%20set%20of%20predefined%20constants.%20Enums%20are%20used%20to%20define%20variables%20that%20can%20only%20take%20one%20out%20of%20a%20small%20set%20of%20possible%20values.%20They%20help%20make%20code%20more%20readable%20and%20less%20error-prone%20by%20providing%20meaningful%20names%20to%20these%20sets%20of%20values.%0A%0A%2F%2F%20Define%20the%20enum%0Aenum%20TrafficLight%20%7B%0A%20%20red%2C%0A%20%20yellow%2C%0A%20%20green%0A%7D%0A%0A%2F%2F%20A%20function%20that%20prints%20a%20message%20based%20on%20the%20traffic%20light%20state%0Avoid%20printTrafficLightMessage(TrafficLight%20light)%20%7B%0A%20%20switch%20(light)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20case%20TrafficLight.red%3A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20print('Stop!')%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20break%3B%0A%20%20%20%20case%20TrafficLight.yellow%3A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20print('Get%20ready...')%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20break%3B%0A%20%20%20%20case%20TrafficLight.green%3A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20print('Go!')%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20break%3B%0A%20%20%7D%0A%7D%0A%0Avoid%20main()%20%7B%0A%20%20%2F%2F%20Example%20usage%20of%20the%20enum%0A%20%20TrafficLight%20currentLight%20%3D%20TrafficLight.green%3B%0A%0A%20%20%2F%2F%20Print%20the%20message%20for%20the%20current%20traffic%20light%20state%0A%20%20printTrafficLightMessage(currentLight)%3B%0A%7D
